Patent Information.Patent Title: Defensin Fragments For Use In Therapy Or Prophylaxis
Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention relates to new peptides derived from HD-5 or HNP-4 having antimicrobial activity for use in modulating the microbiome of intestines, the lungs, the skin, the mouth, the eye, the ear, the vagina or other bodily surfaces and/or for use as an antimicrobial agent in a human or other mammals, as well as to medicaments containing these peptides.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Human defensin-5 (HD-5; Defensin, alpha 5; Human, mammals, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.34206990]Virus:SARS-CoV-2:inhibition of infection in HEK293T-hACE2 cells(60% inhibition at 12.5 μg/mL (3.45 μM));SARS-CoV-2 variant P.1:inhibition of infection in HeLa-hACE2 cells(72% inbibition at 50 μg/mL);SARS-CoV-2 variant B.1.1.7:inhibition of infection in HeLa-hACE2 cells(32% inbibition at 50 μg/mL).Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC 8739 (vLD50=2.5±0.3 µg/ml), E. coli ATCC 25922 (vLD50=2.1±0.9 µg/ml), Enterobacter aerogenes ATCC 13048 (vLD50=5.5±0.5 µg/ml);Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 (vLD50=6.3±0.5 µg/ml), S. aureus ATCC 29213 (vLD50=3.2±0.3 µg/ml), Bacillus cereus ATCC 10876 (vLD50<0.31 µg/ml).(Ref.2)NOTE:vLD50, virtual lethal doses (vLDs), equivalent to conventional 50% lethal doses (LD50s).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.26206286] It has 0% hemolysis at 100μM against human red blood cells.
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.34206990]No cytotoxicity on HEK293T cells up to 50 μg/mL.
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The L- and D-forms of HD-5 are equally active than E.coli but not S. aureus (Wei G et al 2009 JBC 284: 29180-92).
Sequence Information.Function: Antimicrobial activity against Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria. Defensins are thought to kill microbes by permeabilizing their plasma membrane. All DEFA5 peptides exert antimicrobial activities, but their potency is affected by peptide processing.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Paneth cells of the small intestine (at protein level).

Literature.Title: Human Defensins Inhibit SARS-CoV-2 Infection by Blocking Viral Entry.
Literature.Author: Xu C, Wang A, Marin M, Honnen W, Ramasamy S, Porter E, Subbian S, Pinter A, Melikyan GB, Lu W, Chang TL.

Literature.Author: Ghosh D, Porter E, Shen B, Lee SK, Wilk D, Drazba J, Yadav SP, Crabb JW, Ganz T, Bevins CL.

Literature.Title: Antibacterial activity and specificity of the six human {alpha}-defensins.
Literature.Author: Ericksen B, Wu Z, Lu W, Lehrer RI.

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial activity of human  -defensin 5 and its linear analogs N-terminal fatty acylation results in enhanced antimicrobial activity of the linear analogs
Literature.Author: Basil Mathew Ramakrishnan Nagaraj
